How can i make a xorg.conf file?: (general hints only) 1) stop Xorg 2) run "X -configure" (possibly requiring sudo), notice where it places the generated xorg.conf 3) copy/rename the xorg from step2 to /etc/X11/xorg.conf 4) restart XOrg to test
